meanings.sent1: When Mom hugs me, it reassures me.
meanings.sent2: The doctor's kind words reassures the patient.
meanings.sent3: The cozy blanket reassures the scared puppy.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse reassures sailors in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The familiar voice on the phone reassures me instantly.

meanings.definition: To give someone confidence or hope
meanings.sent1: A good luck charm reassures me before the test.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pep talk reassures the team before the game.
meanings.sent3: The lucky socks always reassures him during challenges.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reassures him that everything will be okay.
meanings.sent5: The encouraging words reassures her that she can do it.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel less worried or fearful
meanings.sent1: The night light reassures the child in the dark.
meanings.sent2: Talking to a friend always reassures me when I'm anxious.
meanings.sent3: The silly joke reassures her and makes her laugh.
meanings.sent4: The security guard reassures the scared visitors.
meanings.sent5: The warm tea reassures her during the thunderstorm.
